page.title: 02ROYAL NAVY VICTUALLING DEPT.
page.content: The Royal Victualling Depot in Burnetts Lane was built between 1953 and 1957.It is situated on the railway line between Portsmouth and the Midlands and has special railway sidings to allow easy loading and unloading of supplies. The word "victuals" means food or provisions, and the job of the Depot is to provide food and fuel to the three services (Navy,Army and Air Force).It is the only one of its kind in Britain.The site covers 55 acres, has a storage space of 210,000 square feet and a perimeter fence of 2 miles in length.Security is very strict.Supplies are not only used in Britain,they are sent all round the world.This Depot was responsible for provisioning the Falklands campaign.In a year approximately 3.8 million rations will be produced and
